title: Love Island's India Reynolds hopes her DMs will 'be a bit more full now' after split from Ovie Soko
text:
Love Island's India Reynolds hopes her DMs will be 'a bit more full' now she's single again.

The model, 28, split from co-star boyfriend Ovie Soko, 28, over the weekend just four months after the couple left the villa in third place.

But it seems the vegan chef won't be giving up on love and is hopeful her social media messages will be popping now she's back on the market.

Single and ready to mingle: Love Island's India Reynolds hopes her DMs will be 'a bit more full' now she's single again (pictured at the Pride Of Britain Awards on Monday night)

Speaking to MailOnline on the red carpet at the Pride Of Britain Awards at London's Grosvenor House Hotel on Monday night, she said: 'Maybe they'll [DMs] be a bit more full now.

'I feel like I've been dropped back in the ocean. We'll see. I'm lucky, I've got a really close group of girlfriends, they've been really looking after me.'

MailOnline exclusively revealed on Saturday that India and the basketball player had agreed to 'amicably' part ways due to their conflicting schedules.

Speaking about the split, India said: 'Obviously it's difficult, but any break-up is difficult. It's even more difficult when it's in front of the rest of the world, but I'll be fine.'

It's over: The model, 28, split from co-star boyfriend Ovie Soko, 28, over the weekend just four months after the couple left the villa in third place (pictured together in September)

The couple hadn't managed to see each other for six weeks in the lead-up to their split, but narrowly avoided a run-in on the red carpet at the Pride Of Britain Awards.

Sources close to the pair claimed India and Ovie's busy careers since leaving the Mallorcan villa had made it increasingly difficult for them to be together.

A source told MailOnline last week: 'It's clear things aren't exactly rosy between them. They need time to meet up and work things out.

'They have been trying to get together all week, but their busy work schedules haven't permitted it.'

Sad news: MailOnline exclusively revealed on Saturday that India and the basketball player had agreed to 'amicably' part ways due to their conflicting schedules (pictured in July)

Awkward! The couple hadn't managed to see each other for six weeks in the lead-up to their split, but narrowly avoided a run-in on the red carpet at the Pride Of Britain Awards

Following the news of winners Amber Gill and Irishman Greg O'Shea's split, India previously revealed that the geographical proximity to Ovie has helped them keep the momentum going.

‘It’s so sad! Ovie and I do live quite close, so I guess it is easier for us than it has been for others maybe – they were in different countries. For us it’s an hour so you can just pop in. long-distance is always hard in any relationship’, she mused.

Ovie is currently busy with his role as an ASOS ambassador and fledgling presenting career while India is serving as a Boohoo ambassador.

Maura Higgins and Curtis Pritchard, as well as Molly-Mae Hague and Tommy Fury, are the only remaining couples from this year's Love Island.
description: The model, 28, won't be giving up on love and is hopeful her social media messages will be popping now she's back on the market.
